intro: Hieracium omangii, commonly known as the Omangii hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and often endangered species.
